text.div:
This case-insensitive code system http://worldhealthorganization.github.io/smart-hiv/CodeSystem/HIV.Configuration defines the following codes:

CodeDisplayDefinition
DE1 Population prevalence of TBThe tuberculosis prevalence in the general population in number of cases per 100 000 persons or greater.
DE2 Population prevalence of soil-transmitted helminth infectionThe percentage of individuals in the general population infected with at least one species of soil-transmitted helminths
DE3 Population incidence of HIV in the absence of PrEPHIV incidence number of cases per 100 person–years in the absence of PrEP
DE4 Population prevalence of HIVThe proportion of the population that are HIV-positive
DE5 Prevalence of pretreatment NNRTI drug resistancePrevalence of pretreatment HIV drug resistance to NNRTIs among people initiating first-line ART
DE6 Malaria-endemic settingWhether the setting is a malaria-endemic setting
DE7 Population prevalence of syphilisThe proportion of the population with syphilis
DE8 Population prevalence of hepatitis BThe proportion of hepatitis B surface antigen (HBsAg) seroprevalence in the general population
DE9 Population prevalence of hepatitis CThe proportion of hepatitis C virus (HCV) antibody seroprevalence in the general population
DE10 Prevalence of HIV in the catchment areaThe proportion of the population from the health facility's catchment area that are HIV-positive (estimated)
DE11 Ultrasound available at the health facilityWhether an ultrasound machine is available and functional in the facility and a trained health worker is available to use it
DE12 HIV burden of the settingHIV burden of the setting (high or low) based on the national HIV prevalence or where the HIV prevalence and/or incidence in a geographical setting is higher than national prevalence and, therefore, needs priority in the HIV response
DE13 High HIV burden settingSettings with >5% national HIV prevalence and subpopulations and geographic settings where HIV prevalence and/or incidence is higher than nationally.
DE14 Low HIV burden settingSettings with <5% HIV national prevalence but where certain populations (primarily key populations and their partners) and geographic settings may have higher HIV prevalence and/or incidence than nationally and, therefore, need priority in the HIV response
DE15 HPV DNA testing operational at the health facilityIs HPV DNA testing operational at the health facility for cervical cancer screening?
DE16 Routine viral load testing is availableRoutine viral load testing is available in the facility
DE17 Health facility IDUnique ID of the health facility that recorded the client. This ID could represent a universal health facility ID, if used in the country. Alternatively this ID can also be generated by the national surveillance system and assigned to reporting facility.
DE18 TB treating facility IDThe facility where the client is receiving tuberculosis (TB) treatment
DE19 Other priority populationsOther populations of priority of HIV prevention and care in local context (provided during adaptation)
DE20 Reporting period end dateEnd date of the reporting period
DE21 Reporting period start dateStart date of the reporting period
DE22 Reporting dateReporting date, for surveys performed on a specific date
